snippet.title: The Secrets of Photorealism
snippet.description:
Discover the science to making believable photorealism, and why Toy Story 4 gets everything right.

"The Secrets of Photorealism" by Andrew Price @Blender Guru 
Blender Conference 2022

#BCON22 #b3d

snippet.title: Keynote - Blender Conference 2022
snippet.description:
Blender Conference 2022 "Keynote" by Ton Roosendaal.

Support the Blender project and join https://fund.blender.org.

snippet.title: Procedural fantasy city creation using Geometry Nodes
snippet.description:
The evolution of Geometry Nodes in Blender has enabled the creation of increasingly larger procedural projects and setups over the past year. This talk focuses on the construction of a fantasy city from basic building blocks.

Starting with a simple idea, a city layout and terrain are generated, buildings are grown from the ground up, populated with props and shaded procedurally.

"Procedural fantasy city creation using Geometry Nodes" by Emilis Baltrusaitis
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-29 10:00 at the theater.

snippet.title: "We can do that with Geometry Nodes..."
snippet.description:
In this live tutorial Simon Thommes is showcasing how to incorporate Geometry Nodes into an artistic workflow effectively to solve various challenges in a production environment.

Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-27 11:30 at the classroom.

snippet.title: The Future of Character Animation & Rigging: a Q&A feeback session
snippet.description:
Presentation of the Character Animation & Rigging Workshop that will be held just before the conference. The aim of this presentation is not just to talk about the workshop & its outcomes, but also to solicit feedback on the presented ideas from a wider audience.

"The Future of Character Animation & Rigging: a Q&A feeback session" by Sybren A. Stüvel, Brad Clark, Jason Schleifer
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-28 16:30 at the attic.

snippet.title: Working in the VFX film and TV industry
snippet.description:
My name is Robert Rioux, also known as Blender Bob in the community. I've been working in the vfx film industry for 26 years. I've worked all over the world in many major studios, on huge Hollywood productions and on more than 60 feature films.

At Real by FAKE, we are pushing Blender to its limit with the latest technologies, like filling up a stadium with 100 000 people captured in videogrammetry. 

For BCON, I want to show the world how we use Blender on feature films, TV series and commercials and why I was the best choice for us. I would also like to explain in detail our incredible custom pipeline, the challenges that we had, how we fix them or found ways around them and how we got Blender to work seamlessly with other software.

https://conference.blender.org/

#b3d #bcon22 #vfx

snippet.title: The new Principled BSDF model in Cycles
snippet.description:
After five years of having the Principled BSDF in Cycles, there's now an ongoing development effort to overhaul and modernize it.

This talk will present the background and current state of this work. After starting with the reasoning for why the current Principled BSDF is not good enough anymore, it will introduce the underlying theory of physically based shading, covering concepts such as microfacet models, dielectric vs. conductive materials, Fresnel terms, layering models, energy conservation and preservation etc.

Based on this, it'll cover the current plans for Cycles' new Principled BSDF - the design goals, the components it consists of, the theory that each of them is based on, and how they all combine and interact with each other, as well as the current status of the project and what remains to be done.

"The new Principled BSDF model in Cycles" by Lukas Stockner
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-29 10:00 at the attic.

snippet.title: From Pre to Post
snippet.description:
We will dive into how Blender fits into the film production pipeline at Do. Creative Labs & Rumble Studios. Explore the various roles it takes on, from pre production to post production. We hope to showcase the fun stumbles of film production and how Blender comes to save the day!

Rejin Chamandy at Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-27 11:30 at the studio.

snippet.title: Spaceships,  Concept Design pipeline for Sci-fi.
snippet.description:
Presentation on how to design futuristic props and vehicle.
Balancing design and technique to improve life quality for concept artists. From grease pencil to geometry nodes and procedural materials, i'll do an overview on How the design processcan be easier in order to define ideas faster and help with most tedious parts of the 3d design process.

"Spaceships,  Concept Design pipeline for Sci-fi." by Alberto Petronio
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-29 12:30 at the studio.

snippet.title: Ship dynamics without fluid simulations
snippet.description:
In this presentation, Ignacio will share how he developed a physically based simulator for ships (based on the Archimedes principle and rigid body simulations) that solve the equations of the movement of a ship floating in the ocean in a faster way than the water based simulations.

"Ship dynamics without fluid simulations" by Ignacio Matey
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-29 16:30 at the attic.

snippet.title: 10 years of Grease Pencil, what's next?
snippet.description:
Almost a decade ago it was decided to turn a simple viewport annotation tool like Grease Pencil into a full 2D animated pipeline.

In this talk we will talk about the adoption of Grease Pencil by the industry and the roadmap of what's next: StoryPencil (Grease pencil for storyboards), VR, Geometry nodes? Grease Pencil 3.0?

Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-27 14:30 at the theater.

snippet.title: Creating animations with point clouds
snippet.description:
In this 1-hour session, Midge will use a point cloud scanned at BCON or during the session to create a funky abstract animation loop to celebrate the return to our in-person conference.

He'll guide you through importing and manipulating point clouds in Blender, all the way to rendering and comping your end result.

Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-28 11:00 at the classroom.

snippet.title: Poly Haven: Free content as a business model
snippet.description:
Poly Haven is an online asset library publishing completely free HDRIs, textures and 3D models for Blender. How do we make this work sustainably? What doesn't work? Why are we doing this and why don't we just sell our assets instead? How can you start something similar?

"Poly Haven: Free content as a business model" by Greg Zaal
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-28 15:30 at the theater.

snippet.title: The custom tech behind DillonGoo Studios
snippet.description:
Lateasusual, the primary developer behind the Goo Blender fork, joins Dillon Gu in a talk presenting a deep dive behind the custom tools that make their anime style and Blender-based studio pipeline possible. Join the discussion on how the rendering breakthroughs were made, and how the structure of a studio running fully remote developed a smooth Blender pipeline.

Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-27 12:30 at the studio.

snippet.title: Using geometry nodes for vehicle concept art
snippet.description:
In this presentation Daniel will show how he uses geometry nodes to generate designs for vehicles and spaceships in his work as a concept artist. Using a procedural approach can save a lot of time and generate a lot of different options with very little effort. These generated 3d models can later be refined with a manual touch up either in 2d or 3d.



"Using geometry nodes for vehicle concept art" by Daniel Bystedt
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-28 13:00 at the theater.

snippet.title: Grease Pencil journey with Dédouze
snippet.description:
Dédouze is known for using Blender to create artworks with a 2D look, close to traditional comics and animes, but mixing 3D and 2D elements. In this talk, he will explain how he uses the Grease Pencil tool to create the imaginary worlds from his dreams, and how this tool made him create artworks that he didn't even expect he would ever be able to create.
He will talk about his personal and professional experimentations, and will show how these experiments led him to new animation styles and workflows that wouldn't be possible with other softwares. Grease Pencil is not just about 2D or 2.5D anymore but something completely new, and there are still so many paths to explore !

Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-27 16:00 at the theater.

snippet.title: Blending with Ada
snippet.description:
Ada Sokół is a Polish artist and designer translating the oneiric visions and her own interpretation of the solar punk movement into 3D art. She plays with hyper-realism, creating truly captivating imagery that caught the attention of major brands such as Prada, Valentino, or Nike. Her works are almost entirely made in Blender, showcasing the wide range of possibilities this software gives to an artist.
In this talk, she will share her inspirations, pipeline, and some tips & tricks for creating awe striking visuals influenced by nature.

Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-28 15:00 at the theater.

snippet.title: The Puzzle of "Good" Retopology
snippet.description:
Retopology is often seen as a daunting, complex or just plain boring task.
But on top of that it's also not very obvious what is seen as a "good retopology" when used for film production.

Join this live retopology session to learn practical and theoretical workflows & tools to create consistently great retopologized models in a fun & easy to understand way.

A lot of this will be based on experience from working on Blender Open Movie productions.

Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-27 17:00 at the classroom.

snippet.title: Blender Conference 2022 - Closing event
snippet.description:
Thank you for coming attending Blender Conference 2022. 

You can find all recordings at conference.blender.org.

snippet.title: Game assets production pipeline for Arma Reforger
snippet.description:
In May 2022, Bohemia Interactive released Arma Reforger, a platform that paves the way for Arma 4, the next game in the military sim game series running on a new proprietary game engine called Enfusion.

Blender is heavily used in their internal game asset production pipeline and they also chose it as the main content creation tool for their modding community.

To support internal/community artists, they developed an add-on to help speed up productivity. This talk will reveal some of the pipelines for game asset creation, as well as lessons learned from the development.

"Game assets production pipeline for Arma Reforger" by Miro Horvath
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-29 16:30 at the studio.

snippet.title: Barely 3D - The animation of Noara
snippet.description:
Noara is a MOCA game (multiplayer online chest arena).

Discover the behind-the-scenes, the artistic and technical choices that help to push the style of Noara further.

"Barely 3D - The animation of Noara" by Pierrick PICAUT
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-29 14:30 at the studio.

snippet.title: Develop your 3D style
snippet.description:
Blender changed my life in 360 degrees. Since I began to dedicate myself daily to learning in a self-taught way and constantly sharing my art on social networks, my life changed completely and now I dedicate myself professionally to it and found my own style.

I will also give you a tour through my models, I will tell you about useful tools that I use, important tips on the lighting of my scenes so that you can make yours cozy and some secrets about how to build scenes like mine.

I believe that anyone with the heart of an artist can make a name for themselves in the industry and my advice on how to grow on social networks, build a good portfolio and perseverance will help you find your place in the artistic world.

Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-28 10:00 at the classroom.

snippet.title: Live animation show
snippet.description:
Rik will guide you through the jungle of keys, curves and constraints to discover the true essence of the illusion of life!

"Live animation show" by Rik Schutte
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-28 13:30 at the classroom.

snippet.title: Follow the light: Introducing path guiding in Cycles
snippet.description:
Path guiding is a new feature coming in Blender 3.4 that will dramatically speed up rendering scenes in Cycles that contain complex lighting effects such as multi-bounce global illumination, volumetrics, and even caustics. This session will give a high-level overview of the concepts behind path guiding, how it is integrated into Cycles using Intel’s Open PGL library, and, more importantly, how artists can use this new technique to generate even more beautiful images. We demonstrate the advantages of path guiding on a set of different types of scenes and will give some advice on when path guiding can be helpful and not, as well as what artists need to consider when using it.

Discover all Intel@BCON content (sessions, demos, tech blogs and more) on https://create.intel.com/blender

"Follow the light: Introducing path guiding in Cycles" by Sebastian Herholz
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-28 13:00 at the attic.

snippet.title: Lighting in animated film productions
snippet.description:
Andy's first pro gig as a Blender artist was Elephants Dream in 2006; since then he worked on 12 more open movie projects as lighter and compositor, being responsible for the final look on screen.

In this presentation, we take a glance at the history of Blender Open Movies from the rendering point of view and dive straight into the lighting principles and the workflow of one of the latest Blender film productions: Sprite Fright.

Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-27 13:00 at the classroom.

snippet.title: Rigging with the Blender Studio tools
snippet.description:
A showcase of how I rig characters at the Blender Studio, using tools like CloudRig and Pose Shape Keys.

In just 50 minutes I will try to show every step of my rigging process from scratch, starting with positioning the bones of a "MetaRig" to generate the control rig, through a little bit of rough weight painting, all the way to having a few basic mouth shapes using both bones and shape keys.

Rigging a (unique) character properly from start to finish would take a bit longer than 50 minutes, so don't expect an amazing result here! The focus here is on showcasing the workflow.

"Rigging with the Blender Studio tools" by Demeter Dzadik
Blender Conference 2022
2022-10-29 13:00 at the classroom.
